Each season here has its own peculiar character and distinctive charm. Snow-caped mountains, serene valleys, picturesque skies and (Read More)pristine lakes make Jammu and Kashmir a major tourist attraction. Main tourist places in Kashmir are Srinagar, Sonamarg and Pahalgam. Gulmarg and Patnitop are well known for adventure sports. Ladakh region is also popular among tourists for its landscapes, monasteries and lakes. Jammu and Kashmir is indeed nature's beauty at its very best. Here is the list of 16 Hill Stations in Jammu and Kashmir For A Himalayan Getaway 1. Gulmarg, Jammu & Kashmir - The Skiing School and Honeymoon 4.4 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Gulmarg Gondola Alpather Lake Apharwat Peak Situated at an altitude of 2730 m above sea level, Gulmarg is surrounded by snow-covered mountains, lush green meadows, deep ravines and is an evergreen forested hill station in Jammu and Kashmir. Best Time: October to June 29 Gulmarg Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Srinagar, Jammu & Kashmir - Picturesque hill station in Jammu and Kashmir 4.2 /5 View 38+ photos Known For : Dal Lake Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden Shalimar Bagh Mughal Garden Famously known as ‘Heaven on Earth’, Srinagar is every bit the epitome of paradise on earth. As picturesque as the most stunning painting to ever be painted, Srinagar, the capital of Jammu and Kashmir, lies on the banks of the Jhelum river, and has a cool, pleasant climate all year round, contributing to the perpetual influx of tourists visiting this city which offers a plethora of gorgeous scenic vistas. Best Time: April to October 59 Srinagar Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Sonamarg, Jammu & Kashmir 4.3 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Thajiwas Glacier Zoji La Vishansar Lake Sonamarg is a town with snow-covered flower-laden fields, surrounded by majestic glaciers and serene lakes which casts subtle spells on the visitors. Bounded by natural beauty, breathtaking glaciers and serene lakes the place is a popular hill station in Jammu and Kashmir. Nilagrad, a colony of the Baltics, is a picturesque location that one can always visit. Sonamarg is the home of many beautiful and serene lakes. Best Time: May to October 17 Sonamarg Attractions View Packages Read More 4. Patnitop, Jammu & Kashmir - Photographer's paradise hill station in Jammu and Kashmir 4.6 /5 View 9+ photos Known For : Nathatop Skiing in Patnitop Patni Top Park With endless meadows and panoramic views of the snow capped peaks of the Himalayas, Patnitop is a perfect place to experience nature at its picturesque best and widest. Pahalgam, Jammu & Kashmir - Witness untouched beauty at this hill station in Jammu and Kashmir 4.0 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Aru Valley Betaab Valley River Rafting in Pahalgam With untouched and gorgeous natural beauty, Pahalgam is a feast to the eyes and senses. Submerged in lush greenery and alluring Himalayan ranges, it calls for some moments of requiescence at nature's own home. Sanasar, Jammu & Kashmir - A quieter, lesser known adventure 4.5 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Paragliding Wilderness Adventure Camps(WAC) Naag Mandir One of the lesser known hill stations in Jammu-Kashmir region, Sanasar is an adventure enthusiasts' haven offering various activities such as paragliding, rock climbing, abseiling and trekking. Best Time: April to June 10 Sanasar Attractions Read More 8. Nubra Valley, Jammu & Kashmir 4.2 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Diskit Monastery Hunder Village Panamik Hot Springs This masterpiece of God's own creation lies on the Silk route, in the paradisiacal of Jammu and Kashmir at a distance of around 140 Km from Leh. The valley is embellished with Shyok and Nubra river snaking through it and some beautiful monasteries colored with rich shades of golden, red and others. Best Time: June to September 10 Nubra Valley Attractions View Packages Read More 9. Pulwama, Jammu & Kashmir 4.5 /5 View 9+ photos Known For : Aharbal Waterfall Tarsar and Marsar Lake Kungwattan Pulwama, a small town in Srinagar district, is famous for its apple orchards, waterfalls, natural springs and scenic valleys. It is a stunning hill station in Jammu and Kashmir. Best Time: Throughout the year 10 Pulwama Attractions Read More 10. Jammu, Jammu & Kashmir - City of Temples 4.4 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Shri Raghunath Temple Vaishno Devi Shree Ranbireshwar Temple Be it the multi-hued flags representing the temples and shrines in the city, the tantalizing aromas that lift and diffuse from its spectacular cuisine. Even the snow-capped mountains promise adventure and action in this hill station in Jammu and Kashmir. It is known as the 'City of Temples' and has something to offer to everyone. Best Time: September to March 31 Jammu Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Vaishno Devi, Jammu & Kashmir - The Holy Caves Located in Trikuta hills, 13 km from Katra at the height of 1560 m above sea level with bright clouds and thinning air, this town is the holy cave temple of Mata Vaishnodevi, with spirituality and vibrancy lingering in the atmosphere. Read More 12. Lamayuru, Jammu & Kashmir - Moonland of Ladakh 4.5 /5 View 51+ photos Known For : MoonLand Lamayuru Monastery Uleytokpo Lamayuru is a small hill station in Jammu and Kashmir. It is situated midway between Kargil and Leh on NH1-D also known as the Srinagar- Leh Highway. It is situated 100 km ahead of Leh, after Fotu La- the highest pass on the Srinagar-Leh Highway. Known as the 'place of freedom' and housing the oldest and one of the largest monasteries in Ladakh region, Lamayuru is the place to visit for all those seeking peace and tranquillity.  Lamayuru is immensely famous for a Tibetan Buddhist Monastery located nearby. However, its claim to fame is accredited to the surreal breathtaking view of moonlike landscapes carved into the mountains. A large lake long ago dried up and the protrusions looked like the surface of the moon. Tourists from various places visit this relatively serene destination to immerse in this scenic beauty. Best Time: April to June 5 Lamayuru Attractions Read More 13. Hemis, Jammu & Kashmir - Home to the Snow Leopard Capital of India 4.1 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Hemis National Park Hemis Monastery Gotsang Gompa With beautiful paintings and peaceful serenity, Hemis envelops you in its calmness while the landscape adds to its landscape. Hemi is a quaint little hill station in Jammu and Kashmir perfect for a cosy getaway in solitude. Best Time: April to June 6 Hemis Attractions Read More 14. Khilanmarg, Jammu & Kashmir Khilanmarg is miniature valley set at a 6 km walk and 2000 feet above one of the most sought after tourist destinations in J&K - Gulmarg. Read More 15. Baltal, Jammu & Kashmir 4.8 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Amarnath Yatra Amarnath Cave Sonamarg Set at an altitude of 2743 m, Baltal suffices as a halt destination just about perfectly for all the religious Amarnath Cave pilgrims. At a distance of 14 kms from Amarnath, this place serves as the base camp for devotees with adequate arrangements of pitch tents to spend the night. Best Time: May to September 5 Baltal Attractions Read More 16. Amarnath, Jammu & Kashmir - A haven for pilgrims. 4.0 /5 Known For : Amarnath Cave Amarnath Yatra Baltal Amarnath is one of the most important pilgrimage in India for the worshippers of Lord Shiva. The Amarnath cave is haven to an enshrined image of ice called the Shivaling formed naturally, which resembles Lord Shiva. Best Time: May - July 4 Amarnath Attractions View Packages Read More Which of these hill stations in Jammu and Kashmir do you plan to visit? Let us know in the comments below!
